message: All translations of all fields in all indicators

1-3-1.SDG_GOAL: Goal 1. Eradicate poverty in all its forms and everywhere
1-3-1.SDG_TARGET: 1.3 Put in place social protection systems and measures for all, adapted to the national context, including social protection floors, and ensure that, by 2030, a significant proportion of the poor and vulnerable people benefit from them
1-3-1.SDG_INDICATOR: 1.3.1. Number of mutual associations engaged in the promotion of community development programs (%)
1-3-1.ORGANISATION_UNIT: Department of Social Studies and Statistics and Poverty Monitoring, Ponit focal ODD
1-3-1.CONTACT_FUNCT: Head of Service and Focal Point
1-3-1.STAT_CONC_DEF: Number of the population covered by a mutualist association compared to the total number of the population
1-3-1.COLL_METHOD: Data are collected from household surveys using the "household" questionnaire
1-3-1.FREQ_COLL: The probable date of the next collection will be 2021
1-3-1.COMPILING_ORG: ISTEEBU is responsible for compiling the data for the calculation of this indicator at the national level
1-3-1.INST_MANDATE: ISTEEBU is the body recognized by the Burundian government for the collection, processing and dissemination of official statistics helping in planning and decision-making.
1-3-1.RATIONALE: The indicator is relevant because it reflects the demographic and health situation of the population.
1-3-1.REC_USE_LIM: Updating the indicator requires a household survey which is very resource intensive.
1-3-1.DATA_COMP: Number of the population covered by a mutualist association compared to the total number of the population
1-3-1.DATA_VALIDATION: The results of the survey are validated at two levels: technical validation and official validation before publication
1-3-1.COVERAGE: The indicator is available at the national level, province, area of residence (Woman aged 15 to 49: Urban area; Rural area - Man aged 15 to 49: Urban area; Rural area)
1-3-1.COMPARABILITY: The indicator can be compared to other indicators of the same type at regional and international level
1-3-1.OTHER_DOC: Report of the Demographic and Health Survey 2016-2017

1-3-2.SDG_TARGET: 1.3 Put in place social protection systems and measures for all, adapted to the national context, including social protection floors, and ensure that, by 2030, a significant proportion of the poor and vulnerable people benefit from them

1-3-2.FREQ_COLL: The probable date of the next collection will be 2021
1-3-2.COMPILING_ORG: ISTEEBU is responsible for compiling this indicator at the national level
1-3-2.INST_MANDATE: ISTEEBU is the body recognized by the Burundian government for the collection, processing and dissemination of official statistics helping in planning and decision-making.
1-3-2.RATIONALE: The indicator is relevant because it reflects the demographic and health situation of the population.
1-3-2.REC_USE_LIM: Updating the indicator requires a household survey which is very resource intensive.
1-3-2.DATA_COMP: Number of the population benefiting from health insurance out of the total number of the population
1-3-2.DATA_VALIDATION: The results of the survey are validated at two levels: technical validation and official validation before publication
1-3-2.COVERAGE: The indicator is available at the national level, province, area of residence (Woman aged 15 to 49: Urban area; Rural area - Man aged 15 to 49: Urban area; Rural area)
1-3-2.COMPARABILITY: The indicator can be compared to other indicators of the same type at regional and international level
1-3-2.OTHER_DOC: Report of the Demographic and Health Survey 2016-2017

1-3-3.SDG_GOAL: Goal 1. Eradicate poverty in all its forms and everywhere
1-3-3.SDG_TARGET: 1.3 Put in place social protection systems and measures for all, adapted to the national context, including social protection floors, and ensure that, by 2030, a significant proportion of the poor and vulnerable people benefit from them
1-3-3.CONTACT_FUNCT: SDG focal point at SEP / CPNS
1-3-3.STAT_CONC_DEF: Number of the population receiving a pension in relation to the total population
1-3-3.SOURCE_TYPE: SEP / CNPS, Report on the half-yearly review
1-3-3.COLL_METHOD: Data are collected from survey reports and sectoral statistical yearbooks
1-3-3.FREQ_COLL: Collection takes place every six months
1-3-3.INST_MANDATE: State Institutions are members of the SSN whose mission is to collect, process and disseminate data from their sector.
1-3-3.RATIONALE: The indicator is relevant because it reflects the social security situationi.
1-3-3.REC_USE_LIM: Updating the indicator requires exhaustive data collection in private health mutual funds
1-3-3.DATA_COMP: Number of the population receiving a pension in relation to the total population
1-3-3.DATA_VALIDATION: The results of the data collection are validated at two levels: internal validation and validation at the CTIS level before publication
1-3-3.COVERAGE: The indicator is available at national level.
1-3-3.COMPARABILITY: The indicator can be compared to other indicators of the same type at regional and international level

1-4-1.SDG_GOAL: Goal 1. Eradicate poverty in all its forms and everywhere
1-4-1.SDG_TARGET: 1.4 By 2030, ensure that all men and women, especially the poor and vulnerable, have equal rights to economic resources and have access to basic services, land ownership, control over land and other forms of property, inheritance, natural resources and new technologies and financial services tailored to their needs, including microfinance
1-4-1.SDG_INDICATOR: 1.4.1. Percentage of the population living below the poverty line
1-4-1.ORGANISATION_UNIT: Department of Social Studies and Statistics and Poverty Monitoring, Ponit focal ODD
1-4-1.CONTACT_FUNCT: Head of Service and Focal Point
1-4-1.STAT_CONC_DEF: Number of the population below the national poverty line in relation to the total population
1-4-1.COLL_METHOD: Data are collected from household surveys using the "household" questionnaire
1-4-1.FREQ_COLL: The probable date of the next collection will be 2020
1-4-1.COMPILING_ORG: ISTEEBU is responsible for compiling this indicator at the national level
1-4-1.INST_MANDATE: ISTEEBU is the body recognized by the Burundian government for the collection, processing and dissemination of official statistics helping in planning and decision-making.
1-4-1.RATIONALE: The indicator is relevant because it reflects the situation on the living conditions of the population.
1-4-1.REC_USE_LIM: Updating the indicator requires a household survey that is very resource-intensive and almost all of the funding comes from partners.
1-4-1.DATA_COMP: Number of the population below the national poverty line compared to the total population
1-4-1.DATA_VALIDATION: The results of the survey are validated at two levels: technical validation and official validation before publication
1-4-1.COVERAGE: The indicator is available at national level, province, area of residence (Total; Urban area; Rural area)
1-4-1.COMPARABILITY: The indicator can be compared to other indicators of the same type at regional and international level
1-4-1.OTHER_DOC: Report of the Survey on Household Living Conditions in Burundi

1-4-2.SDG_TARGET: 1.4 By 2030, ensure that all men and women, especially the poor and vulnerable, have equal rights to economic resources and have access to basic services, land ownership, control over land and other forms of property, inheritance, natural resources and new technologies and financial services tailored to their needs, including microfinance
1-4-2.SDG_INDICATOR: 1.4.2. Percentage of the population with health insurance
1-4-2.ORGANISATION_UNIT: Department of Social Studies and Statistics and Poverty Monitoring, Ponit focal ODD

1-4-2.STAT_CONC_DEF: Number of the population benefiting from health insurance out of the total number of the population
1-4-2.COLL_METHOD: Data are collected from household surveys using the "household" questionnaire
1-4-2.FREQ_COLL: The probable date of the next collection will be 2021 (Next DHS)
1-4-2.COMPILING_ORG: ISTEEBU is responsible for compiling this indicator at the national level
1-4-2.INST_MANDATE: ISTEEBU is the body recognized by the Burundian government for the collection, processing and dissemination of official statistics helping in planning and decision-making.
1-4-2.RATIONALE: The indicator is relevant because it reflects the demographic and health situation of the population.
1-4-2.REC_USE_LIM: Updating the indicator requires a household survey which is very resource intensive.
1-4-2.DATA_COMP: Number of the population benefiting from health insurance out of the total number of the population
1-4-2.DATA_VALIDATION: The results of the survey are validated at two levels: technical validation and official validation before publication
1-4-2.COVERAGE: The indicator is available at the national level, province, area of residence (Woman aged 15 to 49: Urban area; Rural area - Man aged 15 to 49: Urban area; Rural area)
1-4-2.COMPARABILITY: The indicator can be compared to other indicators of the same type at regional and international level
1-4-2.OTHER_DOC: Report of the Demographic and Health Survey 2016-2017

1-4-3.SDG_GOAL: Goal 1. Eradicate poverty in all its forms and everywhere
1-4-3.SDG_TARGET: 1.4 By 2030, ensure that all men and women, especially the poor and vulnerable, have equal rights to economic resources and have access to basic services, land ownership, control over land and other forms of property, inheritance, natural resources and new technologies and financial services tailored to their needs, including microfinance
1-4-3.STAT_CONC_DEF: Average number of population for a health center
1-4-3.COLL_METHOD: Data is collected from administrative registers of health facilities
1-4-3.INST_MANDATE: The Ministerial departments are the members of the SSN whose mission is to collect, process and disseminate the data of their sector.
1-4-3.RATIONALE: The indicator is relevant because it reflects the health situation in Burundi.
1-4-3.REC_USE_LIM: Updating the indicator requires exhaustive collection in health facilities. For most of the data, data from private health facilities are not taken into account.
1-4-3.DATA_COMP: Ratio between the number of health centers and the total poulation multiplied by 100
1-4-3.DATA_VALIDATION: The results of the data collection are validated at two levels: internal validation and validation at the CTIS level before publication
1-4-3.COVERAGE: The indicator is available at the national level and by area of residence (Total; Urban area; Rural area)
1-4-3.COMPARABILITY: The indicator can be compared to other indicators of the same type at regional and international level

1-4-4.SDG_GOAL: Goal 1. Eradicate poverty in all its forms and everywhere
1-4-4.SDG_TARGET: 1.4 By 2030, ensure that all men and women, especially the poor and vulnerable, have equal rights to economic resources and have access to basic services, land ownership, control over land and other forms of property, inheritance, natural resources and new technologies and financial services tailored to their needs, including microfinance
1-4-4.SDG_INDICATOR: 1.4.4. Gross enrollment rate in basic school
1-4-4.STAT_CONC_DEF: Number of children at basic level (F1, F2, F3 and F4) out of the number of children aged 7 to 15)
1-4-4.SOURCE_TYPE: Bureau of Educational Planning and Statistics, Statistical Yearbook
1-4-4.COLL_METHOD: Data are collected from surveys of schools using the Questionnaire
1-4-4.INST_MANDATE: The Ministerial departments are the members of the SSN whose mission is to collect, process and disseminate the data of their sector.
1-4-4.RATIONALE: The indicator is relevant because it reflects the educational situation in Burundi.
1-4-4.REC_USE_LIM: Updating the indicator requires a survey of schools in the territory of Burundi. The reluctance is noted for private establishments.
1-4-4.DATA_COMP: Ratio of the number of children at the basic level (F1, F2, F3 and F4) to the number of children aged 7 to 15 multiplied by 100
1-4-4.DATA_VALIDATION: The results of the survey are validated at two levels: internal validation and validation at the CTIS level before publication
1-4-4.COVERAGE: The indicator is available at national level and by sex. (Total; Girls; Boys)
1-4-4.COMPARABILITY: The indicator can be compared to other indicators of the same type at regional and international level

1-4-5.SDG_GOAL: Goal 1. Eradicate poverty in all its forms and everywhere
1-4-5.SDG_TARGET: 1.4 By 2030, ensure that all men and women, especially the poor and vulnerable, have equal rights to economic resources and have access to basic services, land ownership, control over land and other forms of property, inheritance, natural resources and new technologies and financial services tailored to their needs, including microfinance
1-4-5.SDG_INDICATOR: 1.4.5. Penetration rate of financial institutions in the population
1-4-5.CONTACT_FUNCT: SDG focal point at the BRB
1-4-5.STAT_CONC_DEF: Number of people aged 18 and over with a bank account in a microfinance institution compared to the number of people aged 18 and over
1-4-5.SOURCE_TYPE: Bank of the Republic of Burundi
1-4-5.COLL_METHOD: Data are collected from household surveys using the "household" questionnaire
1-4-5.FREQ_COLL: The probable date of the next collection will be 2020
1-4-5.COMPILING_ORG: ISTEEBU is responsible for compiling this indicator at the national level
1-4-5.INST_MANDATE: ISTEEBU is the body recognized by the Burundian government for the collection, processing and dissemination of official statistics helping in planning and decision-making.
1-4-5.RATIONALE: The indicator is relevant because it reflects the level of banking in Burundi.
1-4-5.REC_USE_LIM: Updating the indicator requires a household survey that is very resource-intensive and almost all of the funding comes from partners.
1-4-5.DATA_COMP: Ratio of people aged 18 and over with a bank account in a microfinance institution to the number of the population aged 18 and over multiplied by 100
1-4-5.DATA_VALIDATION: The results of the survey are validated at two levels: technical validation and official validation before publication
1-4-5.COVERAGE: The indicator is available at national level, province, area of residence (Total; Women; Men; Urban area; Rural area)
1-4-5.COMPARABILITY: The indicator can be compared to other indicators of the same type at regional and international level
1-4-5.OTHER_DOC: Report of the Survey on Household Living Conditions in Burundi

1-4-6.DATA_VALIDATION: The results of the survey are validated at two levels: technical validation and official validation before publication
1-4-6.COVERAGE: The indicator is available at national level, province, area of residence (Total; Women; Men; Urban area; Rural area)
1-4-6.COMPARABILITY: The indicator can be compared to other indicators of the same type at regional and international level
1-4-6.OTHER_DOC: Report of the Survey on Household Living Conditions in Burundi

1-4-7.SDG_GOAL: Goal 1. Eradicate poverty in all its forms and everywhere
1-4-7.SDG_TARGET: 1.4 By 2030, ensure that all men and women, especially the poor and vulnerable, have equal rights to economic resources and have access to basic services, land ownership, control over land and other forms of property, inheritance, natural resources and new technologies and financial services tailored to their needs, including microfinance
1-4-7.SDG_INDICATOR: 1.4.7. Percentage of the population with access to the internet
1-4-7.ORGANISATION_UNIT: Department of Social Studies and Statistics and Poverty Monitoring, Ponit focal ODD
1-4-7.CONTACT_FUNCT: Head of Service and Focal Point
1-4-7.STAT_CONC_DEF: Number of people aged 18 and over who used the Internet in the last 12 months preceding the survey compared to the number of people aged 18 and over
1-4-7.COLL_METHOD: Data are collected from household surveys using the "household" questionnaire
1-4-7.FREQ_COLL: The probable date of the next collection will be 2020
1-4-7.COMPILING_ORG: ISTEEBU is responsible for compiling this indicator at the national level
1-4-7.INST_MANDATE: ISTEEBU is the body recognized by the Burundian government for the collection, processing and dissemination of official statistics helping in planning and decision-making.
1-4-7.RATIONALE: The indicator is relevant because it reflects the situation on the living conditions of the population.
1-4-7.REC_USE_LIM: Updating the indicator requires a household survey that is very resource-intensive and almost all of the funding comes from partners.
1-4-7.DATA_COMP: Ratio of people aged 18 and over who used the internet in the last 12 months preceding the survey on the size of the population aged 18 and over multiplied by 100
1-4-7.DATA_VALIDATION: The results of the survey are validated at two levels: technical validation and official validation before publication
1-4-7.COVERAGE: The indicator is available at national level, province, area of residence (Total; Women; Men; Urban area; Rural area)
1-4-7.COMPARABILITY: The indicator can be compared to other indicators of the same type at regional and international level
1-4-7.OTHER_DOC: Report of the Survey on Household Living Conditions in Burundi

1-a-1.SDG_GOAL: Goal 1. Eradicate poverty in all its forms and everywhere
1-a-1.SDG_TARGET: 1.a Ensure a significant mobilization of resources from multiple sources, including through the strengthening of cooperation for development, in order to endow developing countries, in particular the least developed countries, with adequate and predictable means implement programs and policies aimed at ending poverty in all its forms
1-a-1.SDG_INDICATOR: 1.a.1.Proportion of resources directly allocated by the State to poverty reduction programs
1-a-1.STAT_CONC_DEF: This is the share of the state budget allocated to poverty reduction programs
1-a-1.SOURCE_TYPE: Ministry of Finance, Budget and Development Cooperation
1-a-1.COLL_METHOD: Data is collected from administrative documents
1-a-1.INST_MANDATE: The Ministerial departments are the members of the SSN whose mission is to collect, process and disseminate the data of their sector.
1-a-1.RATIONALE: The indicator is relevant because it reflects the distribution of the state budget.
1-a-1.REC_USE_LIM: The update of the indicator requires an exhaustive collection of all government expenditure
1-a-1.DATA_COMP: Budget allocated to poverty reduction programs from the State budget multiplied by 100
1-a-1.DATA_VALIDATION: The data is validated at two levels: internal validation and validation at the CTIS level before publication
1-a-1.COVERAGE: The indicator is available at national level.
1-a-1.COMPARABILITY: Data can be compared to past data

1-a-2.SDG_GOAL: Goal 1. Eradicate poverty in all its forms and everywhere
1-a-2.SDG_TARGET: 1.a Ensure a significant mobilization of resources from multiple sources, including through the strengthening of cooperation for development, in order to endow developing countries, in particular the least developed countries, with adequate and predictable means implement programs and policies aimed at ending poverty in all its forms
1-a-2.SDG_INDICATOR: 1.a.2.Proportion of public expenditure allocated to essential services (education, health and social protection)
1-a-2.STAT_CONC_DEF: This is the share of the state budget allocated to Education, Health and Social Protection
1-a-2.SOURCE_TYPE: Ministry of Finance, Budget and Development Cooperation
1-a-2.COLL_METHOD: Data is collected from administrative documents
1-a-2.INST_MANDATE: The Ministerial departments are the members of the SSN whose mission is to collect, process and disseminate the data of their sector.
1-a-2.RATIONALE: The indicator is relevant because it reflects the distribution of the state budget.
1-a-2.REC_USE_LIM: The update of the indicator requires an exhaustive collection of all government expenditure
1-a-2.DATA_COMP: Budget allocated to Education, Health and Social Protection from the State budget multiplied by 100
1-a-2.DATA_VALIDATION: The data is validated at two levels: internal validation and validation at the CTIS level before publication
1-a-2.COVERAGE: The indicator is available at national level.
1-a-2.COMPARABILITY: Data can be compared to past data

1-a-3.SDG_GOAL: Goal 1. Eradicate poverty in all its forms and everywhere
1-a-3.SDG_TARGET: 1.a Ensure a significant mobilization of resources from multiple sources, including through the strengthening of cooperation for development, in order to endow developing countries, in particular the least developed countries, with adequate and predictable means implement programs and policies aimed at ending poverty in all its forms
1-a-3.SDG_INDICATOR: 1.a.3 Total subsidies and non-debt-generating external flows directly allocated to poverty reduction programs, expressed as a proportion of GDP
1-a-3.STAT_CONC_DEF: It is the ratio between the amount of subsidies and non-debt-generating external flows allocated to poverty reduction programs and the GDP
1-a-3.SOURCE_TYPE: Ministry of Finance, Budget and Development Cooperation
1-a-3.COLL_METHOD: Data is collected from administrative documents
1-a-3.INST_MANDATE: The Ministerial departments are the members of the SSN whose mission is to collect, process and disseminate the data of their sector.
1-a-3.RATIONALE: The indicator is relevant because it reflects the distribution of the state budget.
1-a-3.REC_USE_LIM: The update of the indicator requires an exhaustive collection of all government expenditure
1-a-3.DATA_COMP: Ratio between the amount of subsidies and non-debt-generating external flows allocated to poverty reduction programs and GDP, expressed as a percentage
1-a-3.DATA_VALIDATION: The data is validated at two levels: internal validation and validation at the CTIS level before publication
1-a-3.COVERAGE: The indicator is available at national level.
1-a-3.COMPARABILITY: Data can be compared to past data

1-b-1.SDG_GOAL: Goal 1. Eradicate poverty in all its forms and everywhere
1-b-1.SDG_TARGET: 1.b Establish viable policy frameworks at national, regional and international levels, based on pro-poor and gender-sensitive development strategies, to accelerate investment in gender-sensitive measures. poverty eradication
1-b-1.SDG_INDICATOR: 1.b.1.Proportion of public operating and equipment expenditure devoted to sectors that specifically meet the needs of women, the poor and vulnerable
1-b-1.STAT_CONC_DEF: This is the share of the state budget allocated to sectors that specifically meet the needs of women, poor and vulnerable compared to the state budget.
1-b-1.SOURCE_TYPE: Ministry of Finance, Budget and Development Cooperation
1-b-1.COLL_METHOD: Data is collected from administrative documents
1-b-1.INST_MANDATE: The Ministerial departments are the members of the SSN whose mission is to collect, process and disseminate the data of their sector.
1-b-1.RATIONALE: The indicator is relevant because it reflects the distribution of the state budget.
1-b-1.REC_USE_LIM: The update of the indicator requires an exhaustive collection of all government expenditure
1-b-1.DATA_COMP: Budget allocated to sectors responding more particularly to the needs of women, poor and vulnerable on the State budget multiplied by 100
1-b-1.DATA_VALIDATION: The data is validated at two levels: internal validation and validation at the CTIS level before publication
1-b-1.COVERAGE: The indicator is available at national level.
1-b-1.COMPARABILITY: Data can be compared to past data

10-1-1.SDG_GOAL: Goal 10. Reduce inequalities within and across countries
10-1-1.SDG_TARGET: 10.1 By 2030, gradually and sustainably achieve income growth for the poorest 40% of the population at a rate faster than the national average income
10-1-1.SDG_INDICATOR: 10.1.1 b) Growth rate of household expenditure per capita for the entire population
10-1-1.CONTACT_ORGANISATION: Burundi Institute of Statistics and Economic Studies (ISTEEBU)
10-1-1.ORGANISATION_UNIT: Social Studies and Statistics and Poverty Monitoring Service "SESSSP"
10-1-1.CONTACT_FUNCT: Head of the “Social Studies and Statistics and Poverty Monitoring” department
10-1-1.STAT_CONC_DEF: It is the average annual growth rate of real per capita consumption of the distribution of household income in a country
10-1-1.COLL_METHOD: The data are collected by carrying out surveys type ECVMB
10-1-1.COMPILING_ORG: ISTEEBU is responsible for compiling the data allowing the calculation of this indicator at the national level
10-1-1.INST_MANDATE: ISTEEBU is the body recognized by the Burundian government for the collection, processing and dissemination, after validation, of official statistics helping in planning and decision-making
10-1-1.RATIONALE: The indicator is relevant because it reflects the level of expenditure over a year and allows a comparison to be made
10-1-1.DATA_COMP: It is the ratio between the variation in household expenditure per capita during a given year compared to household expenditure per capita in the previous year,
10-1-1.DATA_VALIDATION: Survey data is validated at two levels: internal validation and extended validation
10-1-1.COVERAGE: The indicator is available at national level

10-2-1.SDG_GOAL: Goal 10. Reduce inequalities within and across countries
10-2-1.SDG_TARGET: 10.2 By 2030, empower all people and promote their social, economic and political integration, regardless of age, gender, disability, race, ethnicity, origin, religion or their economic or other status
10-2-1.STAT_CONC_DEF: It is the number of Burundian refugees abroad who have returned
10-2-1.COLL_METHOD: Data is collected from administrative sources
10-2-1.FREQ_COLL: The probable date of the next collection will be 2020
10-2-1.COMPILING_ORG: The compilation of data for the calculation of this indicator is made by the statistical and planning service of the MIFPDL
10-2-1.INST_MANDATE: The statistics and planning departments of the ministries are responsible for compiling data from their ministries for the calculation of indicators at the secoriel and national level.
10-2-1.RATIONALE: The indicator is relevant because it reflects the state of security, which favors the massive return of refugees
10-2-1.REC_USE_LIM: It is interesting to know that repatriation is voluntary, conditioned or forced.
10-2-1.DATA_COMP: Sum of the refugee population outside the country who returned
10-2-1.DATA_VALIDATION: Data from administrative sources are most often validated by the Technical Committee for Statistical Information (CTIS), after internal validation.
10-2-1.COVERAGE: The indicator is available at national level
10-2-1.COMPARABILITY: The indicator can be compared to other indicators of the same type at regional and international level

10-4-1.SDG_GOAL: Goal 10. Reduce inequalities within and across countries
10-4-1.SDG_TARGET: 10.4 Adopt policies, particularly in the budgetary, salary and social protection fields, in order to gradually achieve greater equality
10-4-1.SDG_INDICATOR: 10.4.1 Share of labor in GDP, including wages and social transfers
10-4-1.CONTACT_ORGANISATION: Burundi Institute of Statistics and Economic Studies (ISTEEBU)
10-4-1.ORGANISATION_UNIT: Social Studies and Statistics and Poverty Monitoring Service "SESSSP"
10-4-1.CONTACT_FUNCT: Head of the “Social Studies and Statistics and Poverty Monitoring” department
10-4-1.STAT_CONC_DEF: It is the total compensation of employees and social transfers made, expressed as a percentage of GDP, that is a measure of total output for a given reference period.
10-4-1.COLL_METHOD: Data are collected by carrying out ECVMB type surveys / daily data from national accounts
10-4-1.COMPILING_ORG: ISTEEBU is responsible for compiling the data allowing the calculation of this indicator at the national level
10-4-1.INST_MANDATE: ISTEEBU is the body recognized by the Burundian government for the collection, processing and dissemination, after validation, of official statistics helping in planning and decision-making
10-4-1.RATIONALE: The indicator provides information on the relative share of production that is paid as compensation to employees compared to the share paid to capital in the production process for a given reference period
10-4-1.REC_USE_LIM: The share of labor in GDP calculated solely on the basis of compensation of employees underestimates the proportion of accumulated GDP in relation to total employment, because it does not include the labor income of the self-employed.
10-4-1.DATA_COMP: Total compensation of employees in relation to gross domestic product, expressed as a percentage
10-4-1.DATA_VALIDATION: Survey data is validated at two levels: internal validation and extended validation
10-4-1.COVERAGE: The indicator is available at national level
10-4-1.OTHER_DOC: ISTEEBU, Survey on the living conditions of Burundian households (ECVMB) 2013-2014, National accounts of 2014

10-b-1.SDG_GOAL: Goal 10. Reduce inequalities within and across countries
10-b-1.SDG_TARGET: 10.b Stimulate official development assistance and financial flows, including foreign direct investment, to states most in need, in particular least developed countries, African countries, small states developing islanders and landlocked developing countries, in accordance with their national plans and programs
10-b-1.SDG_INDICATOR: 10.b.1 Total amount of resources allocated to development, by recipient country and donor and type of contribution (official development assistance, foreign direct investment and others) (in millions of USD)
10-b-1.CONTACT_ORGANISATION: Organisation for Economic Co-operation and Development
10-b-1.ORGANISATION_UNIT: statistical service of the Ministry of Trade, Industry and Tourism
10-b-1.STAT_CONC_DEF: Total amount of resources allocated to development, by recipient and donor country and type of contribution include official development assistance, other official flows and private flows.
10-b-1.INST_MANDATE: The statistics and planning departments of the ministries are responsible for compiling data from their ministries for the calculation of indicators at the national level.
10-b-1.RATIONALE: The indicator is relevant because it reports it quantifies the overall spending that donors provide to developing countries.
10-b-1.REC_USE_LIM: Completeness in data collection is difficult to achieve
10-b-1.DATA_COMP: The sum of official and private flows from all donors to developing countries.
10-b-1.DATA_VALIDATION: Internal validation and by the technical committee for statistical information (CTIS)
10-b-1.COVERAGE: Data are available at national level

11-4-1.SDG_GOAL: Goal 11. Make cities and human settlements inclusive, safe, resilient and sustainable
11-4-1.SDG_TARGET: 11.4 Redouble efforts to protect and preserve the world's cultural and natural heritage
11-4-1.STAT_CONC_DEF: It is the ratio of developed tourist sites to the total number of tourist sites
11-4-1.COLL_METHOD: Data is collected from administrative sources
11-4-1.COMPILING_ORG: The ONT statistical service is responsible for compiling the data for the calculation of this indicator.
11-4-1.INST_MANDATE: The ONT statistical service is responsible for compiling the data for the calculation and internal validation of this indicator.
11-4-1.RATIONALE: The indicator is relevant because it reflects the state of play in terms of the development of tourist sites.
11-4-1.REC_USE_LIM: It is interesting because it allows to know the proportion of tourist sites developed
11-4-1.DATA_COMP: We divide the number of tourist sites that are developed and accessible to tourists by the total number of tourist sites multiply by 100
11-4-1.DATA_VALIDATION: Data from administrative sources are most often validated by the Technical Committee for Statistical Information (CTIS), after internal validation.
11-4-1.OTHER_DOC: Studies on the identification and delimitation of tourist sites / ONT

12-2-1.SDG_GOAL: Objective 12. Establish sustainable consumption and production patterns
12-2-1.SDG_TARGET: 12.2 By 2030, achieve sustainable management and rational use of natural resources
12-2-1.CONTACT_ORGANISATION: Burundi Institute of Statistics and Economic Studies (ISTEEBU)
12-2-1.ORGANISATION_UNIT: Social studies and statistics and poverty monitoring (ESSSP)
12-2-1.STAT_CONC_DEF: Difference between crude birth rate and crude death rate. It measures the increase of a population over a period of time due only to births and deaths
12-2-1.FREQ_COLL: The probable date of the next collection will be 2021 (Next DHS)
12-2-1.COMPILING_ORG: ISTEEBU is responsible for compiling this indicator at the national level
12-2-1.INST_MANDATE: ISTEEBU is the body recognized by the Burundian government for the collection, processing and dissemination of official statistics helping in planning and decision-making.
12-2-1.RATIONALE: This indicator is relevant because it highlights the difference between the crude birth rate and the crude death rate. It measures the increase of a population over a period of time due only to births and deaths
12-2-1.REC_USE_LIM: Updating the indicator requires a household survey which is very resource intensive. The indicator cannot be calculated by gender.
12-2-1.DATA_COMP: It is the difference between the crude birth rate and the crude death rate. It measures the increase of a population over a period of time due only to births and deaths
12-2-1.DATA_VALIDATION: The results of the survey are validated at two levels: technical validation and official validation before publication
12-2-1.COVERAGE: The indicator is available at national level
12-2-1.COMPARABILITY: The indicator can be compared to other indicators of the same type at regional and international level

12-2-2.SDG_GOAL: Objective 12. Establish sustainable consumption and production patterns
12-2-2.SDG_TARGET: 12.2 By 2030, achieve sustainable management and rational use of natural resources
12-2-2.CONTACT_ORGANISATION: Burundi Institute of Statistics and Economic Studies (ISTEEBU)
12-2-2.ORGANISATION_UNIT: Social studies and statistics and poverty monitoring (ESSSP)
12-2-2.STAT_CONC_DEF: The total fertility rate measures the number of children a woman would have, during her fertile life, if she behaved in accordance with the fertility-by-age observed in a given year. It is obtained by adding the average number of births per woman in all the years defined as fertile (from 15 to 49 years)
12-2-2.COLL_METHOD: Data are collected from household surveys using the "household" questionnaire
12-2-2.FREQ_COLL: The probable date of the next collection will be 2021 (Next DHS)
12-2-2.COMPILING_ORG: ISTEEBU is responsible for compiling this indicator at the national level
12-2-2.INST_MANDATE: ISTEEBU is the body recognized by the Burundian government for the collection, processing and dissemination of official statistics helping in planning and decision-making.
12-2-2.RATIONALE: The total fertility rate is relevant because it measures the number of children a woman would have, during her fertile life, if she behaved in accordance with the fertility by age observed in a given year. It is obtained by adding the average number of births per woman in all the years defined as fertile (from 15 to 49 years)
12-2-2.REC_USE_LIM: Updating the indicator requires a household survey which is very resource intensive. The indicator cannot be calculated by gender.
12-2-2.DATA_COMP: It is obtained by adding the average number of births per woman in all the years defined as fertile (from 15 to 49 years)
12-2-2.DATA_VALIDATION: The results of the survey are validated at two levels: technical validation and official validation before publication
12-2-2.COVERAGE: The indicator is available at national level, province, area of residence (National; Urban area; Rural area)
12-2-2.COMPARABILITY: The indicator can be compared to other indicators of the same type at regional and international level

12-4-2.SDG_GOAL: Objective 12. Establish sustainable consumption and production patterns
12-4-2.SDG_TARGET: 12.4 By 2020, achieve environmentally sound management of chemicals and all wastes throughout their life cycle, in accordance with internationally agreed guidelines, and significantly reduce their release to air , water and soil, in order to minimize their negative effects on health and the environment
12-4-2.SDG_INDICATOR: 12.4.2. Percentage of identified treatment sites are operational before 2018 and the maximum before 2025
12-4-2.CONTACT_ORGANISATION: Ministry of Transport, Public Works, Equipment and Land Use Planning (MTTPEAT)
12-4-2.CONTACT_FUNCT: Focal point for the production of the Ministry's SDGs
12-4-2.STAT_CONC_DEF: This is the percentage of functional waste treatment sites compared to all existing waste treatment sites
12-4-2.SOURCE_TYPE: The indicator comes from administrative data
12-4-2.COLL_METHOD: Ratio of functional waste treatment sites to all existing waste treatment sites
12-4-2.INST_MANDATE: SETEMU is the body recognized by the Burundian government as municipal technical services
12-4-2.RATIONALE: This indicator is relevant because it highlights the percentage of functional waste treatment sites compared to all existing waste treatment sites.
12-4-2.DATA_COMP: Ratio of functional waste treatment sites to all existing waste treatment sites
12-4-2.COVERAGE: The indicator is available at national level
12-4-2.COMPARABILITY: The indicator can be compared to other indicators of the same type at regional and international level

12-4-3.SDG_TARGET: 12.4 By 2020, achieve environmentally sound management of chemicals and all wastes throughout their life cycle, in accordance with internationally agreed guidelines, and significantly reduce their release to air , water and soil, in order to minimize their negative effects on health and the environment

14-7-1.SDG_GOAL: Goal 14. Conserve and sustainably use the oceans, seas and marine resources for sustainable development
14-7-1.SDG_TARGET: 14.7 By 2030, extend the economic benefits of the sustainable exploitation of marine resources to small island developing States and least developed countries, including through sustainable management of fisheries, aquaculture and tourism
14-7-1.SDG_INDICATOR: 14.7.1.Percentage of GDP represented by sustainable fishing
14-7-1.STAT_CONC_DEF: It is the share of the added value of fishing in the GDP
14-7-1.INST_MANDATE: ISTEEBU is the body recognized by the Burundian government for the collection, processing and dissemination of official statistics helping in planning and decision-making.
14-7-1.RATIONALE: The indicator is relevant because it makes it possible to determine the main macroeconomic aggregates
14-7-1.REC_USE_LIM: The exhaustiveness of this indicator depends on the regularity and completeness of data collection in the fishing sector.

15-3-1.SDG_GOAL: Objective 15. Preserve and restore terrestrial ecosystems, ensuring that they are used in a sustainable manner, sustainably manage forests, fight against desertification, halt and reverse the process of land degradation and put an end to the loss of biodiversity
15-3-1.SDG_TARGET: 15.3 By 2030, combat desertification, restore degraded lands and soils, including lands affected by desertification, drought and floods, and strive to achieve a land degradation-free world
15-3-1.SDG_INDICATOR: 15.3.1 Surface area of degraded areas in proportion to the land surface
15-3-1.STAT_CONC_DEF: Area of degraded areas as a proportion of the land area
15-3-1.INST_MANDATE: The OBPE as a recognized state structure has a mandate to collect, process and disseminate data from the sector
15-3-1.RATIONALE: The indicator is relevant because it reflects the level of degradation of the land
15-3-1.REC_USE_LIM: The completeness of this indicator depends on the regular collection of data on the level of land degradation
15-3-1.DATA_COMP: Ratio of the area of degraded land at the country level to the total land area of a given country, expressed as a percentage
15-3-1.DATA_VALIDATION: The validation of this indicator was done at national and international level

15-4-1.SDG_GOAL: Objective 15. Preserve and restore terrestrial ecosystems, ensuring that they are used in a sustainable manner, sustainably manage forests, fight against desertification, halt and reverse the process of land degradation and put an end to the loss of biodiversity

15-a-1.SDG_GOAL: Objective 15. Preserve and restore terrestrial ecosystems, ensuring that they are used in a sustainable manner, sustainably manage forests, fight against desertification, halt and reverse the process of land degradation and put an end to the loss of biodiversity

16-1-1.SDG_GOAL: Goal 16. Promote the emergence of peaceful and inclusive societies for sustainable development, ensure access to justice for all and build, at all levels, effective, accountable and inclusive institutions

16-1-1.SDG_INDICATOR: 16.1.1. Percentage of people who have been victims of gender-based violence

16-1-1.COLL_METHOD: Data are collected from household surveys using the "household" questionnaire

16-6-1.SDG_GOAL: Goal 16. Promote the emergence of peaceful and inclusive societies for sustainable development, ensure access to justice for all and build, at all levels, effective, accountable and inclusive institutions
16-6-1.SDG_TARGET: 16.6 Build effective, accountable and transparent institutions at all levels
16-6-1.SDG_INDICATOR: 16.6.1. Level of confidence of the population in the main state institutions (Parliament, Government, Justice)
16-6-1.CONTACT_NAME: Social studies and statistics and poverty monitoring (ESSSP)
16-6-1.STAT_CONC_DEF: This is the percentage of the population whose last experience with public services was satisfactory
16-6-1.COLL_METHOD: Data are collected from household surveys using the "household" questionnaire
16-6-1.FREQ_COLL: The probable date of the next collection will be 2021
16-6-1.COMPILING_ORG: ISTEEBU is responsible for compiling this indicator at the national level
16-6-1.INST_MANDATE: ISTEEBU is the body recognized by the Burundian government for the collection, processing and dissemination of official statistics helping in planning and decision-making.
16-6-1.RATIONALE: This indicator is relevant because it highlights the difference between the crude birth rate and the crude death rate. It measures the increase of a population over a period of time due only to births and deaths
16-6-1.REC_USE_LIM: Updating the indicator requires a household survey which is very resource intensive. The indicator cannot be calculated by gender.
16-6-1.DATA_COMP: Ratio of the population whose last experience with public services was satisfactory to the total population, expressed as a percentage
16-6-1.DATA_VALIDATION: The results of the survey are validated at two levels: technical validation and official validation before publication
16-6-1.COMPARABILITY: The indicator can be compared to other indicators of the same type at regional and international level

16-6-4.OTHER_DOC: Transparency International report on corruption perception / World Bank website

16-6-5.SDG_GOAL: Goal 16. Promote the emergence of peaceful and inclusive societies for sustainable development, ensure access to justice for all and build, at all levels, effective, accountable and inclusive institutions
16-6-5.SDG_TARGET: 16.6 Build effective, accountable and transparent institutions at all levels
16-6-5.CONTACT_FUNCT: SDG focal point within the Ministry
16-6-5.STAT_CONC_DEF:
The Ibrahim Index of Governance in Africa (IIAG) is a tool for measuring and monitoring governance performance in African countries. The Mo Ibrahim Foundation defines governance as access to goods and public services, in the political, social and economic fields to which each citizen can legitimately claim from his state and which every state is required to offer to its fellow citizens. Within the framework of the IIAG, a country's governance performance is measured using four components: Security and Rule of Law, Participation and Human Rights,
Sustainable economic development and human development.
16-6-5.INST_MANDATE: It is the service of the ministry recognized by the government of Burundi
16-6-5.COMPARABILITY: The indicator can be compared to other indicators of the same type at regional and international level
16-6-5.OTHER_DOC: Transparency International report on corruption perception / World Bank website

2-1-1.SDG_GOAL: Goal 2. End hunger, achieve food security, improve nutrition and promote sustainable agriculture
2-1-1.SDG_TARGET: 2.1 By 2030, end hunger and ensure that everyone, especially the poor and those in vulnerable situations, including infants, have year-round access to healthy, nutritious and sufficient food
2-1-1.ORGANISATION_UNIT: Department of Social Studies and Statistics and Poverty Monitoring, Ponit focal ODD
2-1-1.CONTACT_FUNCT: Head of Service and Focal Point
2-1-1.STAT_CONC_DEF:
Household size 1) has minimal food consumption, but unable to meet certain essential non-food expenses without depleting livelihoods, 2) with poor food consumption, or,
Marginal capacity to meet minimum food needs only through accelerated exhaustion of livelihoods, 3) with significant deficiency in food consumption, or,
Extreme loss of livelihood resulting in severe deficiencies in food consumption, or worse as a proportion of the total number of households
2-1-1.COLL_METHOD: Data are collected from household surveys using the "household" questionnaire
2-1-1.FREQ_COLL: The probable date of the next collection will be 2020
2-1-1.COMPILING_ORG: ISTEEBU is responsible for compiling this indicator at the national level
2-1-1.INST_MANDATE: ISTEEBU is the body recognized by the Burundian government for the collection, processing and dissemination of official statistics helping in planning and decision-making.
2-1-1.RATIONALE: The indicator is relevant because it reflects the nutritional situation and food security of the population.
2-1-1.REC_USE_LIM: Updating the indicator requires a household survey which requires a lot of resources and most of which is donated by partners
2-1-1.DATA_COMP:
Ratio of households 1) has minimal food consumption, but unable to meet certain essential non-food expenses without depleting livelihoods, 2) with poor food consumption, or,
Marginal capacity to meet minimum food needs only through accelerated exhaustion of livelihoods, 3) with significant deficiency in food consumption, or,
Extreme loss of livelihood resulting in severe deficiencies in food consumption, or worse and the total number of households, multiplied by 100
2-1-1.DATA_VALIDATION: The results of the survey are validated at two levels: technical validation and official validation before publication
2-1-1.COVERAGE: Available at the national level and by place of residence (National; Urban; Rural)
2-1-1.COMPARABILITY: The indicator can be compared to other indicators of the same type at regional and international level

2-2-1.SDG_GOAL: Goal 2. End hunger, achieve food security, improve nutrition and promote sustainable agriculture
2-2-1.SDG_TARGET: 2.2 By 2030, end all forms of malnutrition, including achieving by 2025 internationally agreed targets for stunting and wasting in children under 5 years, and meet the nutritional needs of adolescent girls, pregnant or breastfeeding women and the elderly
2-2-1.SDG_INDICATOR: 2.2.1. Number of underweight children under 5 (Acute malnutrition)
2-2-1.ORGANISATION_UNIT: Department of Social Studies and Statistics and Poverty Monitoring, Ponit focal ODD
2-2-1.CONTACT_FUNCT: Head of Service and Focal Point
2-2-1.STAT_CONC_DEF: Acute malnutrition is a form of undernutrition. It is caused by a decrease in food intake and / or associated disease causing bilateral edema and / or sudden weight loss. Its severe form is characterized by the presence of bilateral edema or emaciation (low weight-for-height z-score or low MUAC). We distinguish the Global Acute Malnutrition (MAG) which is the sum of Moderate Acute Malnutrition (MAM) and Severe Acute Malnutrition (SAM).
2-2-1.COLL_METHOD: Data are collected from household surveys using the "household" questionnaire
2-2-1.FREQ_COLL: The probable date of the next collection will be 2020
2-2-1.COMPILING_ORG: ISTEEBU is responsible for compiling this indicator at the national level
2-2-1.INST_MANDATE: ISTEEBU is the body recognized by the Burundian government for the collection, processing and dissemination of official statistics helping in planning and decision-making.
2-2-1.RATIONALE: The indicator is relevant because it reports on the nutritional situation of children under 5 years old.
2-2-1.REC_USE_LIM: Updating the indicator requires a household survey which requires a lot of resources and most of which is donated by partners
2-2-1.DATA_COMP: It is defined as a weight-for-height (PTZ) z-score less than two standard deviations of the median of the reference population.
2-2-1.DATA_VALIDATION: The results of the survey are validated at two levels: technical validation and official validation before publication
2-2-1.COVERAGE: The indicator is available at national level, province, Place of residence (Total; Girls; Boys; 6-11 months; 12-23 months; 24-59 months)
2-2-1.COMPARABILITY: The indicator can be compared to other indicators of the same type at regional and international level
2-2-1.OTHER_DOC: Report of the Survey on the nutritional situation in Burundi

2-2-2.SDG_GOAL: Goal 2. End hunger, achieve food security, improve nutrition and promote sustainable agriculture
2-2-2.SDG_TARGET: 2.2 By 2030, end all forms of malnutrition, including achieving by 2025 internationally agreed targets for stunting and wasting in children under 5 years, and meet the nutritional needs of adolescent girls, pregnant or breastfeeding women and the elderly
2-2-2.ORGANISATION_UNIT: Department of Social Studies and Statistics and Poverty Monitoring, Ponit focal ODD
2-2-2.CONTACT_FUNCT: Head of Service and Focal Point
2-2-2.STAT_CONC_DEF: Stunting, or chronic malnutrition, is a form of undernutrition. Stunting is the result of prolonged and repeated episodes of undernutrition.
2-2-2.COLL_METHOD: Data are collected from household surveys using the "household" questionnaire
2-2-2.FREQ_COLL: The probable date of the next collection will be 2020
2-2-2.COMPILING_ORG: ISTEEBU is responsible for compiling this indicator at the national level
2-2-2.INST_MANDATE: ISTEEBU is the body recognized by the Burundian government for the collection, processing and dissemination of official statistics helping in planning and decision-making.
2-2-2.RATIONALE: The indicator is relevant because it reports on the nutritional situation of children under 5 years old.
2-2-2.REC_USE_LIM: Updating the indicator requires a household survey which requires a lot of resources and most of which is donated by partners
2-2-2.DATA_COMP: It is defined as a height-for-age (TAZ) z-score less than two standard deviations of the median of the reference population.
2-2-2.DATA_VALIDATION: The results of the survey are validated at two levels: technical validation and official validation before publication
2-2-2.COVERAGE: The indicator is available at national level, province, Place of residence (Total; Girls; Boys; 0-11 months; 12-23 months; 24-59 months)
2-2-2.COMPARABILITY: The indicator can be compared to other indicators of the same type at regional and international level
2-2-2.OTHER_DOC: Report of the Survey on the nutritional situation in Burundi

2-2-3.SDG_GOAL: Goal 2. End hunger, achieve food security, improve nutrition and promote sustainable agriculture
2-2-3.SDG_TARGET: 2.2 By 2030, end all forms of malnutrition, including achieving by 2025 internationally agreed targets for stunting and wasting in children under 5 years, and meet the nutritional needs of adolescent girls, pregnant or breastfeeding women and the elderly
2-2-3.SDG_INDICATOR: 2.2.3. Prevalence of underweight in children under 5 years old

2-2-3.STAT_CONC_DEF: It is a composite indicator and results in low weight for age. Weight-for-age (PAZ) is a nutritional index that reflects a combination of acute and chronic growth disorders.
2-2-3.COLL_METHOD: Data are collected from household surveys using the "household" questionnaire
2-2-3.FREQ_COLL: The probable date of the next collection will be 2020
2-2-3.COMPILING_ORG: ISTEEBU is responsible for compiling this indicator at the national level
2-2-3.INST_MANDATE: ISTEEBU is the body recognized by the Burundian government for the collection, processing and dissemination of official statistics helping in planning and decision-making.
2-2-3.RATIONALE: The indicator is relevant because it reports on the nutritional situation of children under 5 years old.
2-2-3.REC_USE_LIM: Updating the indicator requires a household survey which requires a lot of resources and most of which is donated by partners
2-2-3.DATA_COMP: It is calculated by a weight for age of the child compared to a standard or to a reference population of the same age.
2-2-3.DATA_VALIDATION: The results of the survey are validated at two levels: technical validation and official validation before publication
2-2-3.COVERAGE: The indicator is available at national level, province, Place of residence (Total; Girls; Boys; 0-11 months; 12-23 months; 24-59 months)
2-2-3.COMPARABILITY: The indicator can be compared to other indicators of the same type at regional and international level

2-3-1.SDG_GOAL: Goal 2. End hunger, achieve food security, improve nutrition and promote sustainable agriculture
2-3-1.SDG_TARGET: 2.3 By 2030, double the agricultural productivity and incomes of small-scale food producers, in particular women, indigenous people, family farmers, pastoralists and fishermen, including by ensuring equal access to land, other productive resources and factors of production, knowledge, financial services, markets and opportunities for value addition and non-agricultural employment
2-3-1.STAT_CONC_DEF: it is the ratio between the volume of agricultural production on the number of agricultural workers or the volume of agricultural labor hours
2-3-1.COLL_METHOD: Data are collected from household surveys using the "household" questionnaire
2-3-1.FREQ_COLL: The probable date of the next collection will be 2021 (Next DHS)
2-3-1.COMPILING_ORG: MINEAGRIE is responsible for compiling this indicator at the national level
2-3-1.INST_MANDATE: The Ministerial departments in charge of statistical production are members of the SSN and have a mandate to collect, process and disseminate official statistics helping in planning and decision-making.
2-3-1.RATIONALE: The indicator is relevant because it reflects the situation on plant and animal production
2-3-1.REC_USE_LIM: Updating the indicator requires a household survey which requires a lot of resources and most of which is donated by partners
2-3-1.DATA_COMP: Ratio of the volume of agricultural production to the number of agricultural workers or the volume of agricultural labor hours, expressed in tonnes per worker
2-3-1.DATA_VALIDATION: The results of the survey are validated at two levels: technical validation and official validation before publication
2-3-1.COVERAGE: The indicator is available at national level
2-3-1.COMPARABILITY: The indicator can be compared to other indicators of the same type at regional and international level
2-3-1.OTHER_DOC: Report of the National Survey of Agriculture in Burundi

3-1-1.SDG_GOAL: Goal 3. Ensure healthy lives and promote well-being for all at all ages
3-1-1.SDG_TARGET: 3.1 By 2030, reduce the global maternal mortality rate to below 70 per 100,000 live births
3-1-1.ORGANISATION_UNIT: Department of Social Studies and Statistics and Poverty Monitoring, Ponit focal ODD
3-1-1.CONTACT_FUNCT: Head of Service and Focal Point
3-1-1.STAT_CONC_DEF: These are the deaths of women recorded during pregnancy, childbirth or after childbirth, whether in health structures or in the community. The denominator is estimated from data from the population projection. The ratio between the number of women who died during pregnancy, childbirth or after childbirth, whether in health facilities or in the community, and the number of births
3-1-1.UNIT_MEASURE: Number of women per hundred thousand live births
3-1-1.COLL_METHOD: Data are collected from household surveys using the "household" questionnaire
3-1-1.FREQ_COLL: The probable date of the next collection will be 2021 (Next DHS)
3-1-1.COMPILING_ORG: ISTEEBU is responsible for compiling this indicator at the national level
3-1-1.INST_MANDATE: ISTEEBU is the body recognized by the Burundian government for the collection, processing and dissemination of official statistics helping in planning and decision-making.
3-1-1.RATIONALE: The indicator is relevant because it reflects the demographic and health situation of the population.
3-1-1.REC_USE_LIM: Updating the indicator requires a household survey which is very resource intensive.
3-1-1.DATA_COMP: The indicator measures the deaths of women during pregnancy, childbirth or after childbirth, both in health facilities and in the community. The denominator is estimated from data from the population projection.
3-1-1.DATA_VALIDATION: The results of the survey are validated at two levels: technical validation and official validation before publication
3-1-1.COVERAGE: The indicator is available at national level
3-1-1.COMPARABILITY: The indicator can be compared to other indicators of the same type at regional and international level
3-1-1.OTHER_DOC: Report of the Demographic and Health Survey 2016-2017

3-1-2.SDG_GOAL: Goal 3. Ensure healthy lives and promote well-being for all at all ages
3-1-2.SDG_TARGET: 3.1 By 2030, reduce the global maternal mortality rate to below 70 per 100,000 live births
3-1-2.SDG_INDICATOR: 3.1.2. Percentage of births attended by trained health personnel
3-1-2.ORGANISATION_UNIT: Department of Social Studies and Statistics and Poverty Monitoring, Ponit focal ODD
3-1-2.CONTACT_FUNCT: Head of Service and Focal Point
3-1-2.STAT_CONC_DEF: it is the number of deliveries attended by qualified health personnel (doctor, midwife, nurse) and the total number of pregnancies expected during the last 12 months
3-1-2.COLL_METHOD: Data are collected from household surveys using the "household" questionnaire
3-1-2.FREQ_COLL: The probable date of the next collection will be 2021 (Next DHS)
3-1-2.COMPILING_ORG: ISTEEBU is responsible for compiling this indicator at the national level
3-1-2.INST_MANDATE: ISTEEBU is the body recognized by the Burundian government for the collection, processing and dissemination of official statistics helping in planning and decision-making.
3-1-2.RATIONALE: The indicator is relevant because it reflects the demographic and health situation of the population.
3-1-2.REC_USE_LIM: Updating the indicator requires a household survey which is very resource intensive.
3-1-2.DATA_COMP: Ratio between the number of deliveries conducted by a person with at least the qualification of auxiliary birth attendant and the total number of deliveries multiplied by 100.
3-1-2.DATA_VALIDATION: The results of the survey are validated at two levels: technical validation and official validation before publication
3-1-2.COVERAGE: The indicator is available at national level, province, area of residence (Total; Urban area; Rural area)
3-1-2.COMPARABILITY: The indicator can be compared to other indicators of the same type at regional and international level
3-1-2.OTHER_DOC: Report of the Demographic and Health Survey 2016-2017

3-1-3.SDG_GOAL: Goal 3. Ensure healthy lives and promote well-being for all at all ages
3-1-3.SDG_TARGET: 3.1 By 2030, reduce the global maternal mortality rate to below 70 per 100,000 live births
3-1-3.ORGANISATION_UNIT: Department of Social Studies and Statistics and Poverty Monitoring, Ponit focal ODD
3-1-3.CONTACT_FUNCT: Head of Service and Focal Point
3-1-3.STAT_CONC_DEF: Number of live births who died before reaching a week divided by Total number of live births during a period multiplied by 1000
3-1-3.COLL_METHOD: Data are collected from household surveys using the "household" questionnaire
3-1-3.FREQ_COLL: The probable date of the next collection will be 2021 (Next DHS)
3-1-3.COMPILING_ORG: ISTEEBU is responsible for compiling this indicator at the national level
3-1-3.INST_MANDATE: ISTEEBU is the body recognized by the Burundian government for the collection, processing and dissemination of official statistics helping in planning and decision-making.
3-1-3.RATIONALE: The indicator is relevant because it reflects the demographic and health situation of the population.
3-1-3.REC_USE_LIM: Updating the indicator requires a household survey which is very resource intensive.
3-1-3.DATA_COMP: The neonatal (early) mortality rate is the probability (expressed as a rate per 1000 live births) of a stillborn child of dying before reaching one week (7 days).
3-1-3.DATA_VALIDATION: The results of the survey are validated at two levels: technical validation and official validation before publication
3-1-3.COVERAGE: The indicator is available at national level, province, Place of residence (Total; Girls; Boys; Urban area; Rural area)
3-1-3.COMPARABILITY: The indicator can be compared to other indicators of the same type at regional and international level
3-1-3.OTHER_DOC: Report of the Demographic and Health Survey 2016-2017

3-2-1.SDG_GOAL: Goal 3. Ensure healthy lives and promote well-being for all at all ages
3-2-1.SDG_TARGET: 3.2 By 2030, eliminate preventable deaths of infants and children under 5, with all countries aiming to reduce neonatal mortality to 12 per 1,000 live births or less and child mortality under 5 from 5 years to 25 per 1,000 live births at most
3-2-1.SDG_INDICATOR: 3.2.1. Prevalence of underweight in children under 5 years old

3-2-1.INST_MANDATE: ISTEEBU is the body recognized by the Burundian government for the collection, processing and dissemination of official statistics helping in planning and decision-making.
3-2-1.RATIONALE: The indicator is relevant because it reports on the nutritional situation of children under 5 and the food security of the population.
3-2-1.REC_USE_LIM: Updating the indicator requires a household survey which requires a lot of resources and most of which is donated by partners

3-2-1.COMPARABILITY: The indicator can be compared to other indicators of the same type at regional and international level
3-2-1.OTHER_DOC: Report of the Survey on the Nutritional Situation and Food Security in Burundi

3-2-2.SDG_TARGET: 3.2 By 2030, eliminate preventable deaths of infants and children under 5, with all countries aiming to reduce neonatal mortality to 12 per 1,000 live births or less and child mortality under 5 from 5 years to 25 per 1,000 live births at most
3-2-2.ORGANISATION_UNIT: Department of Social Studies and Statistics and Poverty Monitoring, Ponit focal ODD
3-2-2.CONTACT_FUNCT: Head of Service and Focal Point

3-2-2.COLL_METHOD: Data are collected from household surveys using the "household" questionnaire

3-2-2.COMPILING_ORG: ISTEEBU is responsible for compiling this indicator at the national level
3-2-2.INST_MANDATE: ISTEEBU is the body recognized by the Burundian government for the collection, processing and dissemination of official statistics helping in planning and decision-making.
3-2-2.RATIONALE: The indicator is relevant because it reflects the demographic and health situation of the population.

3-2-2.COVERAGE: The indicator is available at national level, province, Place of residence (Total; Girls; Boys; Urban area; Rural area)

3-3-1.SDG_GOAL: Goal 3. Ensure healthy lives and promote well-being for all at all ages
3-3-1.SDG_TARGET: 3.3 By 2030, end the epidemic of AIDS, tuberculosis, malaria and neglected tropical diseases and combat hepatitis, water-borne diseases and other communicable diseases
3-3-1.STAT_CONC_DEF: The HIV / AIDS prevalence rate (15-49 years) is the proportion of the population aged 15 to 49 who test positive for HIV / AIDS in relation to the total population aged 15 to 49
3-3-1.COLL_METHOD: Data is collected from administrative registers of health facilities
3-3-1.INST_MANDATE: The Ministerial departments are the members of the SSN whose mission is to collect, process and disseminate the data of their sector.
3-3-1.RATIONALE: The indicator is relevant because it reflects the health situation in Burundi.
3-3-1.REC_USE_LIM: Updating the indicator requires exhaustive collection in health facilities. For most of the data, data from private health facilities are not taken into account.
3-3-1.DATA_COMP: Ratio of the population aged 15 to 49 tested positive for HIV / AIDS to the total population aged 15 to 49 multiplied by 100
3-3-1.DATA_VALIDATION: The results of the data collection are validated at two levels: internal validation and validation at the CTIS level before publication
3-3-1.COVERAGE: The indicator is available at national level and by sex. (Total; Women; Men)
3-3-1.COMPARABILITY: The indicator can be compared to other indicators of the same type at regional and international level

3-3-2.SDG_GOAL: Goal 3. Ensure healthy lives and promote well-being for all at all ages
3-3-2.SDG_TARGET: 3.3 By 2030, end the epidemic of AIDS, tuberculosis, malaria and neglected tropical diseases and combat hepatitis, water-borne diseases and other communicable diseases
3-3-2.STAT_CONC_DEF: The testing rate is an indicator that shows the percentage of people who have been tested and are aware of their HIV status in the total population
3-3-2.COLL_METHOD: Data is collected from administrative registers of health facilities
3-3-2.INST_MANDATE: The Ministerial departments are the members of the SSN whose mission is to collect, process and disseminate the data of their sector.
3-3-2.RATIONALE: The indicator is relevant because it reflects the health situation in Burundi.
3-3-2.REC_USE_LIM: Updating the indicator requires exhaustive collection in health facilities. For most of the data, data from private health facilities are not taken into account.
3-3-2.DATA_COMP: (Total number of people screened divided by Total population) multiplied by 100
3-3-2.DATA_VALIDATION: The results of the data collection are validated at two levels: internal validation and validation at the CTIS level before publication
3-3-2.COVERAGE: The indicator is available by gender. (Total; Women; Men)
3-3-2.COMPARABILITY: The indicator can be compared to other indicators of the same type at regional and international level

3-3-3.SDG_GOAL: Goal 3. Ensure healthy lives and promote well-being for all at all ages
3-3-3.SDG_TARGET: 3.3 By 2030, end the epidemic of AIDS, tuberculosis, malaria and neglected tropical diseases and combat hepatitis, water-borne diseases and other communicable diseases
3-3-3.SDG_INDICATOR: 3.3.3. Coverage of PMTCT services (Prevention of Materno-Child transmission of HIV AIDS
3-3-3.STAT_CONC_DEF: This is the proportion of pregnant women who test positive for HIV / AIDS who are on PMTCT compared to all women who test positive for HIV / AIDS during a given period.
3-3-3.COLL_METHOD: Data is collected from administrative registers of health facilities
3-3-3.INST_MANDATE: The Ministerial departments are the members of the SSN whose mission is to collect, process and disseminate the data of their sector.
3-3-3.RATIONALE: The indicator is relevant because it reflects the health situation in Burundi.
3-3-3.REC_USE_LIM: Updating the indicator requires exhaustive collection in health facilities. For most of the data, data from private health facilities are not taken into account.
3-3-3.DATA_COMP: (Number of pregnant women who tested positive for HIV who are on PMTCT during a given period divided by the total number of women who tested positive for HIV during that same period) multiplied by 100.
3-3-3.DATA_VALIDATION: The results of the data collection are validated at two levels: internal validation and validation at the CTIS level before publication
3-3-3.COVERAGE: The indicator is available at national level.
3-3-3.COMPARABILITY: The indicator can be compared to other indicators of the same type at regional and international level

3-3-4.SDG_GOAL: Goal 3. Ensure healthy lives and promote well-being for all at all ages
3-3-4.SDG_TARGET: 3.3 By 2030, end the epidemic of AIDS, tuberculosis, malaria and neglected tropical diseases and combat hepatitis, water-borne diseases and other communicable diseases
3-3-4.STAT_CONC_DEF: The prevalence of malaria is the number of cases of malaria for children under 5 out of the total number of children under 5.

3-3-4.INST_MANDATE: The Ministerial departments are the members of the SSN whose mission is to collect, process and disseminate the data of their sector.
3-3-4.RATIONALE: The indicator is relevant because it reflects the health situation in Burundi.
3-3-4.REC_USE_LIM: Updating the indicator requires exhaustive collection in health facilities. For most of the data, data from private health facilities are not taken into account.

3-7-1-a).SDG_GOAL: Goal 3. Ensure healthy lives and promote well-being for all at all ages
3-7-1-a).SDG_TARGET: 3.7 By 2030, ensure universal access to sexual and reproductive health-care services, including for family planning, information and education, and ensure that the reproductive health in national strategies and programs
3-7-1-a).SDG_INDICATOR: 3.7.1.a) Modern contraceptive prevalence rate for women aged 15-49
3-7-1-a).ORGANISATION_UNIT: Department of Social Studies and Statistics and Poverty Monitoring, Ponit focal ODD
3-7-1-a).CONTACT_FUNCT: Head of Service and Focal Point
3-7-1-a).STAT_CONC_DEF: It is the ratio of women aged 15 to 49 who use a contraceptive method to all women aged 15 to 49 during the year.
3-7-1-a).COLL_METHOD: Data are collected from household surveys using the "household" questionnaire
3-7-1-a).FREQ_COLL: The probable date of the next collection will be 2021 (Next DHS)
3-7-1-a).COMPILING_ORG: ISTEEBU is responsible for compiling this indicator at the national level
3-7-1-a).INST_MANDATE: ISTEEBU is the body recognized by the Burundian government for the collection, processing and dissemination of official statistics helping in planning and decision-making.
3-7-1-a).RATIONALE: The indicator is relevant because it reflects the demographic and health situation of the population.
3-7-1-a).REC_USE_LIM: Updating the indicator requires a household survey which is very resource intensive.
3-7-1-a).DATA_COMP: (Number of women aged 15 to 49 who use a contraceptive method in the given year divided by the total number of women aged 15 to 49 minus the number of expected pregnancies during the year) multiplied by 100
3-7-1-a).DATA_VALIDATION: The results of the survey are validated at two levels: technical validation and official validation before publication
3-7-1-a).COVERAGE: The indicator is available at national level, province, area of residence (Total; Urban area; Rural area)
3-7-1-a).COMPARABILITY: The indicator can be compared to other indicators of the same type at regional and international level
3-7-1-a).OTHER_DOC: Report of the Demographic and Health Survey 2016-2017

3-7-1.SDG_GOAL: Goal 3. Ensure healthy lives and promote well-being for all at all ages

3-7-1.STAT_CONC_DEF: It is the ratio between women aged 15 to 49 in union who use a contraceptive method and all women aged 15 to 49 in union during the year.
3-7-1.COLL_METHOD: Data are collected from household surveys using the "household" questionnaire
3-7-1.FREQ_COLL: The probable date of the next collection will be 2021 (Next DHS)
3-7-1.COMPILING_ORG: ISTEEBU is responsible for compiling this indicator at the national level
3-7-1.INST_MANDATE: ISTEEBU is the body recognized by the Burundian government for the collection, processing and dissemination of official statistics helping in planning and decision-making.
3-7-1.RATIONALE: The indicator is relevant because it reflects the demographic and health situation of the population.
3-7-1.REC_USE_LIM: Updating the indicator requires a household survey which is very resource intensive.
3-7-1.DATA_COMP: (Number of women aged 15 to 49 in union who used a contraceptive method during the year in question divided by the total number of women aged 15 to 49 in union minus the number of pregnancies expected during the year. year) multiplied by 100
3-7-1.DATA_VALIDATION: The results of the survey are validated at two levels: technical validation and official validation before publication
3-7-1.COVERAGE: The indicator is available at national level, province, area of residence (Total; Urban area; Rural area)
3-7-1.COMPARABILITY: The indicator can be compared to other indicators of the same type at regional and international level

3-8-1.SDG_GOAL: Goal 3. Ensure healthy lives and promote well-being for all at all ages
3-8-1.SDG_TARGET: 3.8 Ensure that everyone has universal health coverage, including protection against financial risks and providing access to quality essential health services and to safe, effective, quality and cost-effective essential medicines and vaccines. affordable
3-8-1.ORGANISATION_UNIT: Department of Social Studies and Statistics and Poverty Monitoring, Ponit focal ODD
3-8-1.CONTACT_FUNCT: Head of Service and Focal Point
3-8-1.STAT_CONC_DEF: This is the proportion of children aged 12 to 23 months who received all doses of vaccines
3-8-1.COLL_METHOD: Data are collected from household surveys using the "household" questionnaire
3-8-1.FREQ_COLL: The probable date of the next collection will be 2021 (Next DHS)
3-8-1.COMPILING_ORG: ISTEEBU is responsible for compiling this indicator at the national level
3-8-1.INST_MANDATE: ISTEEBU is the body recognized by the Burundian government for the collection, processing and dissemination of official statistics helping in planning and decision-making.
3-8-1.RATIONALE: The indicator is relevant because it reflects the demographic and health situation of the population.
3-8-1.REC_USE_LIM: Updating the indicator requires a household survey which is very resource intensive.
3-8-1.DATA_COMP: Number of children aged 12 to 23 months who received all doses of vaccine multiplied by 100 and divided by the expected population of 12 to 23 months.
3-8-1.DATA_VALIDATION: The results of the survey are validated at two levels: technical validation and official validation before publication
3-8-1.COVERAGE: The indicator is available at national level, province, area of residence (Total; Urban area; Rural area)

3-8-2.SDG_GOAL: Goal 3. Ensure healthy lives and promote well-being for all at all ages
3-8-2.SDG_TARGET: 3.8 Ensure that everyone has universal health coverage, including protection against financial risks and providing access to quality essential health services and to safe, effective, quality and cost-effective essential medicines and vaccines. affordable
3-8-2.SDG_INDICATOR: 3.8.2. Coverage of PMTCT services (Prevention of Materno-Childhood Transmission of HIV)
3-8-2.STAT_CONC_DEF: This is the proportion of pregnant women who test positive for HIV / AIDS who are on PMTCT compared to all women who test positive for HIV / AIDS during a given period.
3-8-2.COLL_METHOD: Data is collected from administrative registers of health facilities
3-8-2.INST_MANDATE: The Ministerial departments are the members of the SSN whose mission is to collect, process and disseminate the data of their sector.
3-8-2.RATIONALE: The indicator is relevant because it reflects the health situation in Burundi.
3-8-2.REC_USE_LIM: Updating the indicator requires exhaustive collection in health facilities. For most of the data, data from private health facilities are not taken into account.
3-8-2.DATA_COMP: (Number of pregnant women who tested positive for HIV who are on PMTCT during a given period divided by the total number of women who tested positive for HIV during that same period) multiplied by 100.
3-8-2.DATA_VALIDATION: The results of the data collection are validated at two levels: internal validation and validation at the CTIS level before publication
3-8-2.COVERAGE: The indicator is available at national level.

3-b-2-2.SDG_GOAL: Goal 3. Ensure healthy lives and promote well-being for all at all ages
3-b-2-2.SDG_TARGET: 3.b Support research and development of vaccines and drugs against diseases, communicable or not, which mainly affect the inhabitants of developing countries, provide affordable access to essential drugs and vaccines, in accordance with the Declaration Doha Round of the Agreement on Trade-Related Aspects of Intellectual Property Rights (TRIPS) and Public Health, which reaffirms the right of developing countries to take full advantage of the flexibility provisions of this agreement when it comes to protecting public health and, in particular, ensuring universal access to medicines
3-b-2-2.SDG_INDICATOR: 3.b.2.2. The share of health expenditure in GDP
3-b-2-2.STAT_CONC_DEF: It is the proportion of total health expenditure in relation to GDP
3-b-2-2.SOURCE_TYPE: Ministry of Finance, Budget and Development Cooperation
3-b-2-2.COLL_METHOD: Data is collected from administrative documents
3-b-2-2.INST_MANDATE: The Ministerial departments are the members of the SSN whose mission is to collect, process and disseminate the data of their sector.
3-b-2-2.RATIONALE: The indicator is relevant because it reflects the distribution of the state budget.
3-b-2-2.REC_USE_LIM: The update of the indicator requires an exhaustive collection of all government expenditure
3-b-2-2.DATA_COMP: Ratio of health expenditure to GDP, multiplied by 100
3-b-2-2.DATA_VALIDATION: The data is validated at two levels: internal validation and validation at the CTIS level before publication
3-b-2-2.COVERAGE: The indicator is available at national level.
3-b-2-2.COMPARABILITY: Data can be compared to past data

3-c-1.REC_USE_LIM: Updating the indicator requires exhaustive collection in health facilities. For most of the data, data from private health facilities are not taken into account.
